children.text:
The modPow function in Java is implemented with exponentiation by squaring. So in Fortran, we can write a function modPow(b, e, mod) that returns (b^e mod mod). Implementing modPow in Fortran:

function modPow(b, e, mod_val) result(res)
   integer(8), intent(in) :: b, e, mod_val
   integer(8) :: res, x, y
   res = 1
   x = mod(b, mod_val)
   y = e
   do while (y > 0) if (btest(y, 0)) then  ! if y is odd
         res = mod(res * x, mod_val)
      end if
      x = mod(x * x, mod_val)
      y = rshift(y, 1)
   end do
end function modPow

children.text:
The GCD of two integers can be computed with the Euclidean algorithm. function gcd(a, b) result(g)
   integer(8), intent(in) :: a, b
   integer(8) :: g, x, y, r
   x = a
   y = b
   do while (y /= 0) r = mod(x, y)
      x = y
      y = r
   end do
   g = x
end function gcd

program main

   implicit none

   integer(8), parameter :: mod_value = 1000000007_8

   integer :: N

   integer(8), allocatable :: A(:)

   integer(8) :: current_lcm, ans, modLcm, i, m, n_second_part

children.text:
Read input

   read*, N

   allocate(A(N)) read*, A

   ! Compute LCM mod mod_value

   current_lcm = 1_8

   do i = 1, N

      integer(8) :: a = A(i)

      integer(8) :: g = gcd(current_lcm, a)

      current_lcm = (current_lcm * a) / g

      current_lcm = mod(current_lcm, mod_value)

   end do

   modLcm = current_lcm

   ! Compute ans

   ans = 0_8

   do i = 1, N

      integer(8) :: ai = A(i)

      integer(8) :: inv_ai = modPow(ai, mod_value-2, mod_value)

      ans = mod(ans + modLcm * inv_ai, mod_value)

   end do

   ! Now, second part: process ans as n

   n_second_part = ans

   !

Implementing modPow in Fortran:

function modPow(b, e, mod_val) result(res)
   integer(8), intent(in) :: b, e, mod_val
   integer(8) :: res, x, y
   res = 1
   x = mod(b, mod_val)
   y = e
   do while (y > 0)
      if (btest(y, 0)) then  ! if y is odd
         res = mod(res * x, mod_val)
      end if
      x = mod(x * x, mod_val)
      y = rshift(y, 1)
   end do
end function modPow

Now, the GCD function. The GCD of two integers can be computed with the Euclidean algorithm.

function gcd(a, b) result(g)
   integer(8), intent(in) :: a, b
   integer(8) :: g, x, y, r
   x = a
   y = b
   do while (y /= 0)
      r = mod(x, y)
      x = y
      y = r
   end do
   g = x
end function gcd

program main

   implicit none

   integer(8), parameter :: mod_value = 1000000007_8

   integer :: N

   integer(8), allocatable :: A(:)

   integer(8) :: current_lcm, ans, modLcm, i, m, n_second_part

   ! Read input

   read*, N

   allocate(A(N))

   read*, A

   ! Compute LCM mod mod_value

   current_lcm = 1_8

   do i = 1, N

      integer(8) :: a = A(i)

      integer(8) :: g = gcd(current_lcm, a)

      current_lcm = (current_lcm * a) / g

      current_lcm = mod(current_lcm, mod_value)

   end do

   modLcm = current_lcm

   ! Compute ans

   ans = 0_8

   do i = 1, N

      integer(8) :: ai = A(i)

      integer(8) :: inv_ai = modPow(ai, mod_value-2, mod_value)

      ans = mod(ans + modLcm * inv_ai, mod_value)

   end do

   ! Now, second part: process ans as n

   n_second_part = ans

   ! Output the second part's result

   write(*,'(I0, " ")') n_second_part

   m = n_second_part

   do i = n_second_part -1, 1, -1

      if (mod(m, i) == 0) then

         write(*,'(I0, " ")') i

         m = i

      end if

   end do

contains

   ! Define the gcd function

   integer(8) function gcd(a, b)

      integer(8), intent(in) :: a, b

      integer(8) :: x, y, r

      x = a

      y = b

      do while (y /= 0)

         r = mod(x, y)

         x = y

         y = r

      end do

      gcd = x

   end function gcd

   ! Define modPow function

   integer(8) function modPow(b, e, mod_val)

      integer(8), intent(in) :: b, e, mod_val

      integer(8) :: res, x, y

      res = 1_8

      x = mod(b, mod_val)

      y = e

      do while (y > 0_8)

         if (btest(y, 0)) then

            res = mod(res * x, mod_val)

         end if

         x = mod(x * x, mod_val)

         y = rshift(y, 1)

      end do

      modPow = res

   end function modPow

end program main
